globalFilterModel.description: globalFilterModel defines the OData model that contains entity definitions relevant for global filters.

globalFilterEntityType.description: globalFilterEntityType defines the entity type to use as a global filter in the smart filter bar control.

globalFilterEntitySet.description: globalFilterEntitySet defines the entity set to use as global filter in the smart filter bar control.

containerLayout.description: containerLayout represents the layout of the card container, as fixed or resizable. The default value is fixed.

smartVariantRequired.description: Set smartVariantRequired to false to deactivate smart variant management in the global filters. The default value is true.

showDateInRelativeFormat.description: Set showDateInRelativeFormat to true to enable relative or normal date formatting in OVP applications.

enableLiveFilter.description: Set enableLiveFilter to true to activate a live update in the global filter. The default requires the user to click the Go button..

imageSupported.description: imageSupported allows the condensed list card to show images or icons.

considerAnalyticalParameters.description: considerAnalyticalParameters enables analytical parameter support for the smart filter bar.

refreshIntervalInMinutes.description: refreshIntervalInMinutes represents the time interval in minutes to auto refresh the card models.

useDateRangeType.description: Set useDateRangeType to true to enable semantic date range control for the smart filter bar.

showDataLabel.description: Set the showDataLabel property to true to make data labels visible in analytical cards.

filterSettings.description: The global filter lets end users filter the data displayed on one or more cards.

dateSettings.description: You can define date ranges, such as lastYear or nextQuarter on the Smart Filter Bar

showBasicSearch.description: Determines if the basic search shall be part of the global filters.

disableErrorPage.description: Disables the error page of OVP. Error page in OVP appears only when all cards have failed.

bHeaderExpanded.description: Shows smart filter bar in expanded mode.

fields.description: For a fields' list you can define the set of standard date range values separately.

useDateRange.description: If set to true all date fields with filter restriction interval will be treated as DateTimeRange filters.

selectedValues.description: The selectedValues property is a set of standard date range values that you want to include or exclude.

exclude.description: The exclude property is set to True by default. This means excluding all values given as selectedValues from the list of date range filters. If the exclude property is set to False, the application shows only selected values in the list of date range filters.

selectedValues.description: The selectedValues property is a set of standard date range values that you want to include or exclude.

exclude.description: The exclude property is set to True by default. This means excluding all values given as selectedValues from the list of date range filters. If the exclude property is set to False, the application shows only selected values in the list of date range filters.

customDateRangeImplementation.description:
This property references a JS class, which you use to modify the date range value list. You can either remove standard data range values or add custom values.
The customDateRangeImplementation setting takes priority followed by filter and selectedValues when excluding date range types.

filter.description: You can use the filter settings to include and exclude specific date range values.

path.description: Choose 'key' to define filter values for single values of the date range, or 'category' to filter by a whole subset.

contains.description: The 'contains' string specifies a filter describing a set of values of the date range type.

equals.description: Defines a single value of the standard date range type.

exclude.description: The exclude property is set to True by default. This means excluding all values given as selectedValues from the list of date range filters. If the exclude property is set to False, the application shows only selected values in the list of date range filters.

defaultValue.description: You can set a default value for semantic date range.

operation.description: The operation property is the value that will be set for semantic date range.

model.description: Represents the model for the card

template.description: Represents the card component path to use for this card.

settings.description: Represents the properties that are passed to the custom card.

entitySet.description: Represents the dominant entity set that will be displayed in the given card.

title.description: The language-dependent title of the card, used in the card header.
title.i18nClassification: TIT: Title of the card, used in the card header

subTitle.description: The language-dependent subtitle of the card, used in the card header.
subTitle.i18nClassification: TIT: Subtitle of the card, used in the card header

dataPointAnnotationPath.description: Represents the data point annotation path.

selectionPresentationAnnotationPath.description: Represents the selection presentation annotation path.

category.description: The category of the card, as used in the card header.

defaultSpan.description: To load cards with specific requirements, define a default size as part of the card definition in the descriptor file.

cols.description: Represents the number of the number of grid columns

rows.description: Represents the number of the number of grid rows

showOnlyHeader.description: Represents if user wants to show only header part of card in resizable layout

minimumTitleRow.description: If user wants to show more text in title then he/she can configure no of lines to be shown in title(Maximum allowed 3 lines)

minimumSubTitleRow.description: If user wants to show more text in title then he/she can configure no of lines to be shown in sub-title(Maximum allowed 2 lines)

requireAppAuthorization.description: Define an authorization check at card level.

tabs.description: Represents the card with view switch control.

addODataSelect.description: add $Select parameter in data fetch URL

sortBy.description: Defines the property by which the list shall be sorted.

dynamicSubtitleAnnotationPath.description: Represents the dynamic subtitle annotation path.

showRefresh.description: Show or hide refresh option under card more actions, default value is true.

enableLocaleCurrencyFormatting.description: Represents the flag to indicate the use of object number/smart field.

showFilterInHeader.description: Represents a switch to Show or Hide Filters in Cards Headers in OVP application.

showSortingInHeader.description: Represents a switch to Show or Hide Sorting in Cards Headers in OVP application.

customParams.description:
Custom parameters for intent-based navigation to the target application.
Enter the name of the custom parameter function defined in your custom controller file.

TabSetting.description: Represents the tab specific properties - properties that are passed to a particular tab in a card

dataPointAnnotationPath.description: Represents the data point annotation path

dynamicSubtitleAnnotationPath.description: Represents the dynamic subtitle annotation path

value.description: Represents the drop down value to be shown

chartProperties.description: This property is responsible for setting specific chart settings

colorPalette.description: Represents the configuration to customize the column stacked chart

PlotAreaDef.description: Plot area is a parent property which defines multiple other properties for smoothness and marker size

isSmoothed.description: Represents whether smoother curves are required or not

markerSize.description: Represents the size of the markers in scatter plots

dataLabel.description: dataLabel is a parent property that defines other properties for type

type.description: Defines whether to display percentage values or actual counts in the donut chart

TimeAxisDef.description: Represents the configuration to customize the time axis

levels.description: Plot area is a parent property which defines multiple other properties for smoothness and marker size

model.description: Represents the model for the List Card

template.description: Represents the card component path to use for this List Card.

listCardSettings.description: Represents the properties that are passed to the list card.

listFlavor.description: Represents the flavor of the list to use in this card. The flavor can be bar chart, carousel or standard.

listType.description: Represents the type of list to use for this card. The list can be extended to display more information or condensed to take up less space on the card.

showLineItemDetail.description: Flag for show line item detail in list and table card.

enableAddToInsights.description: Removes the option to add cards to the Insights section.

imageSupported.description: Flag for enabling images in a condensed list card.

valueSelectionInfo.description: Represents things like people, number of items.

entitySet.description: Represents the dominant entity set that will be displayed in the given card.

title.description: The language-dependent title of the card, used in the card header.

itemText.description: Represents the user defined string in placeholder card.

showFirstActionInFooter.description: Represents the flag to show first action in footer of the Quickview cards

customActions.description: Represents the custom actions in the Quick View Cards

CustomActionsSetting.description: Represents the properties for the custom actions in the Quick View Cards

press.description: Name of the press handler for extended actions in Quick View

headerAnnotationPath.description: headerAnnotationPath represents the path to a HeaderInfo annotation.

model.description: Represents the model for the TableCard.

template.description: Represents the Table Card component path to use for this card.

tableCardSettings.description: Represents the properties that are passed to the table card.

disableTableCardFlexibility.description:
If you set disableTableCardFlexibility to true, then at runtime, DataField records are sorted according to the importance set in the com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ImportanceType annotation, and their order of entry.
If you set disableTableCardFlexibility to false, then at runtime, table columns are sorted according to the importance set in the com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.ImportanceType annotation, and their order of entry.
